intro: Disphyma clavellatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy. It is a flowering plant native to Australia, characterized by its small, white to pale yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Disphyma clavellatum is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
